history.content:
I took EE16B, CS61C, and CS170 last semester so I think the workload will probably be roughly comparable. I thought it was manageable, but I didn't really have time for anything else. I think it was especially tough since 16B and 170 problem sets were due around the same time each week. If they were spread out a bit more I would have found it more manageable. 

If you're L&S and need a good grade in CS70 though, it might be a good idea to choose 2 out of the 3 you listed.

children.subject: I am taking EE16B and CS70 right now. The combination is quite tough, and you will find EE16B challenging even if you are good in the electronics side of EECS, simply because the course is very fast paced (especially once you are done with circuits) and covers a lot of material. I could not imagine having 61c on top of that. CS 70 is also as fast paced (maybe even more) as EE16B, and covers a lot of material too. Psets for EE16B this semester are due Thursdays and CS70s are due Friday. I would avoid adding 61c on top of that. Take a breadth and choose whether you want to take 61c or 16b out of the way faster

Anon here: I just remembered that 61C also has hw assignments on edX, though it doesn't compare to the 16B and 70 homeworks. They were relatively straight forward, assuming you had a good understanding of the material.

I took CS61C, EE16B, and Physics 7B last semester (CS70 is more difficult than 7B imo). Like everyone's saying, 61C and 16B are very fast paced, and cover a wide range of topics. In my opinion, it is doable. Yet it would require a lot of focus and good time management. EE16B and CS70 have weekly problem sets. If you stay on top of the material and work on the problem sets throughout the week, you will be fine. In terms of workload, CS61C only has programming assignments and 4 projects. If you're the kind of student that reviews lecture material in advance, finishes assignments early, and is generally on top of your academics, then you can definitely do it. If you are the kind of student that waits until the last minute to finish an assignment or study for an exam, then I suggest taking two out of the three classes you listed, like Rafael and Anon said above.

history.content: Anyone have any thoughts on taking EE16B, CS61C, and CS70 in one semester? Will this be too tough?
history.subject: 16B, 70, 61C
